alert.note: Alert for Delta; Hopkins; Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 10:17AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Delta, Hopkins, and Lamar Counties * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall which will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, and another inch of rain is possible through noon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sulphur Springs, Cooper, Cumby, Como, Lake Sulphur Springs, Cooper Lake State Park, Cooper Lake, Sulphur Bluff, Brashear, Saltillo, Big Creek Lake, Pickton, Klondike, Lake Fork Reservoir, Pattonville, Deport, Pine Forest, Tira, Birthright and New Birthright.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
